results.title: The Island of Dr Moreau
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Edward Pressman and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dr. Moreau is brilliant geneticist on the brink of superseding evolution. When a UN diplomat visits the island laboratory he discovers experiments turning animal life forms into human-like beasts. The beasts revolt, threatening not only the island but ultimately all mankind.

constellations_other.name: Migrations
constellations_other.description: Universal Everything's Migrations features fantastical creatures born from elements of other animals, just like the titles in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Doctors of Evil
constellations_other.description: Villains get all the best lines and if they're mad scientists, they get all the best toys too. Evil Dr Ironstein from Flight of the Amazon Queen is one member of long lineage of science supervillains.

results.creator_credit_for_label: John Frankenheimer, Edward Pressman and New Line Cinema
results.description: Dr. Moreau is brilliant geneticist on the brink of superseding evolution. When a UN diplomat visits the island laboratory he discovers experiments turning animal life forms into human-like beasts. The beasts revolt, threatening not only the island but ultimately all mankind. Adapted from the H.G. Wells story. Cast includes Val Kilmer, Marlon Brando, David Thewlis, Fairuza Balk, Ron Perlman, Temuera Morrison.

results.title: Only two can play
results.creator_credit: Sidney Gilliat, Leslie Gilliat, British Lion Films and Frank Launder
results.brief_description: Classic black and white British comedy from the 1960s starring the indomitable Peter Sellers as a lusty (but married) Welsh librarian. Set in Aberdarcy Wales, the Public Library is visited by the chairman’s wife (Mai Zetterling) in search of picture books to research costume design for the Aberdarcy Players new amateur theatrical. She flirts shamelessly with the librarian John Lewis (Sellers) and they attempt to have an affair. His potential for job promotion and his marriage seem to be in jeopardy as a result. Richard Attenborough has a guest appearance as a rival for his wife’s (Virginia Maskell) affections. A witty plot filled with as many cigarettes as sharp one-liners, a delightful film. Based on the novel “That uncertain feeling” by Kinsley Amis.

results.title: Stolen kisses = Baisers voles
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, Marcel Berbert, Les Films du Carrosse and Les Productions Artistes Associes
results.brief_description: The romantic and carefree nature of a young Frenchman in 1960s Paris is explored in this the third film by Truffaut to feature the character Antoine Doinel. Antoine is dishonourably discharged from the army and sets about to find himself a new job and to be re-acquainted with his girlfriend Michelle. Along the way he ends up as a private detective set with the task of disguising himself as a stock boy in a shoe store to find out why the staff don’t like the boss. He himself ends up being rather taken with the boss’s wife! Cast includes Jean-Pierre Leaud, Delphine Seyrig, Claude Jade, and Michel Lonsdale. Disc also includes another short Truffaut film “Antoine and Colette”, shot in black and white. Antoine Doinel falls for a music student, but spends an evening with her parents while she’s out on a date. Available on 16mm title number X000897.

results.title: Sex and Lucia = Lucia y el sexo
results.creator_credit: Julio Medem, Enrique Lopez Lavigne, Fernando Bovaira, Alicia Produce, Canal+ Espana and Sogecine
results.brief_description: Lucia’s life and her past merge when she is shocked by the death of her lover, a writer. Seeking answers to his death, she travels to an island idyll where she remembers but also makes new connections to a couple who have a past with her now dead partner. Visually stunning and erotically charged, this film is not just about sex but a search for truth, love and living life to the full. This arresting film by the maker of “Tierra” and “The Red Squirrel” is edgy, luscious and hot. Cast includes Paz Vega, Tristan Ulloa, Najwa Nimri, Daniel Freire. Warning: contains full frontal nudity and sex scenes. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Boston strangler
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Robert Fryer and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on a true story this 70’s thriller is a powerful and horrifying police drama. It follows the story of the hunt for a serial killer who has raped and murdered dozens of women in the Boston area. Rapists and sexual offenders are dragged from the street to undergo interrogation in the hope of finding the killer. Disturbing and tense this film is extremely well acted, and uses the then fashionable multi-image technique. A docudrama that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Cast includes Tony Curtis, Henry Fonda, Hurd Hatfield and George Kennedy.

results.title: Women in revolt
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Andy Warhol and Factory Films
results.brief_description: Peter Morrissey and Andy Warhol collaborate in this mordant satire about the women’s movement and its impact. Three transvestites - Holly Woodlawn, Jackie Curtis, and Candy Darling - play the three lead roles, and in a series of melodramas, rage about their lot and how to overcome it. In an attempt at liberation the women launch a revolutionary feminist group called PIGS (Politically Involved Girls). With three extravagant, outrageous performances, this is more stream-of-consciousness theatre than linear cinema, providing a brilliant lampooning of society and 1970s feminism.

results.title: Trash = Andy Warhol presents Trash
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Andy Warhol and Score Movies
results.brief_description: The desolation of the characters of “Trash” is clear from the outset as a go-go dancer attempts to fellate the impotent Joe (Joe Dallesandro) whose interest in sex appears to have diminished under the weight of heroin addiction. The narrative sees a succession of men and women try to seduce Joe, who remains indifferent to them all. Joe’s girlfriend, played by transvestite Holly Woodlawn, despairs of their lifestyle, but nevertheless has a preoccupation with trawling through trash for discarded treasure. Part of a Paul Morrissey/Joe Dallesandro/Andy Warhol, trilogy “Trash” examines the seedy underbelly of New York life - the junkies, hustlers, hookers and marginalised artists, some of whom were a part of Warhol’s “Factory”. Long considered an underground classic, “Trash” is a non-linear examination of culture and the inequities evident to those hanging at the lower echelons of society. Features full frontal nudity, sexual scenes and graphic drug use. Please note: scenes may disturb some viewers.

results.title: Madam Wang's
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Daniel Woodruff and Factory Films
results.brief_description: A masochistic East German is washed up on a beach, and goes about searching for Jane Fonda (then in her aerobics queen era) in order to recruit her to the cause of communism. He hooks up with a group of outsiders, selling junk at a local flea market, whilst others prostitute themselves. Failing in his quest to recruit Jane, the young man embraces the American lifestyle auditioning for Madam Wang - owner of a venue that gives punk bands a start. With this social satire, director and Warhol cohort, Paul Morrissey targets the consumerist American lifestyle, whilst finding pathos amid the characters fringe dwelling. Please note: the quality of the transfer is of average quality.

results.title: Blood for Dracula [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Andrew Braunsberg and Compagnia Cinematografica Champion S P A
results.brief_description: Another Paul Morrissey film presented by Andy Warhol. Here is the Dracula story with the usual search for virgin blood. This very corny and at times funny film is quite gory and blood thirsty. The virgins, that Dracula seeks so hungrily and travels so far to find, unfortunately can not be found as the family of young aristocratic women are no longer virgins. Dracula becomes ill after drinking their blood. There is the usual killing of Dracula scene where the ever hissing vampire is having arms and legs removed by an axe. The blood flows rapidly and still the vampire hisses. A mixture of the erotic and the satirical. Featuring performances by Roman Polanski and Vittorio De Sica.

results.title: Flesh for Frankenstein [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Andrew Braunsberg and Compagnia Cinematografica Champion
results.brief_description: Co-produced by Andy Warhol, this film was directed by Factory stalwart Paul Morrissey with mostly Italian funding. In a broad interpretation of the ever-popular gothic horror story by Mary Shelley, Baron Frankenstein, a necrophiliac, has created two creatures, male and female, intending that they produce a super-breed of the human race. Permeating the narrative with incestuous and sado-masochistic overtones, the story recurrently features disembowelling, torture and brutal sex acts. Reading the film as wickedly pure camp is probably the best way to derive pleasure from its deliberate sensationalism, violence, gore, cheesy production values and bad acting. But despite its artistic short-comings, some interpreted the film as a comment on American excesses, particularly sexual, that will be undeniably passed onto the next generation (represented by a pair of souless children, products of an incestuous and loveless relationship) who will revel even more joyously in extravagant and amoral degradation and corruption. Starring Udo Kier as Baron Frankenstein. Originally filmed in Spacevision 3-D, this is the flat version. Only loosely based on the novel by Mary Shelley, this film presents the erotic, horrific, gory and outrageous adaptation of the, by comparison, rather sweet novel. It is a cult classic enjoying a camp status similar to other Paul Morrissey films. There are zombies, silent children, incestuous relationships, necrophilia and gruesomeness set in the familiar mad scientist laboratory. A black comedy, a schlock horror. Cast includes Joe Dallesandro (Andy Warhol’s factory star), Udo Kier, Monique Van Mooren, and Arno Juerging.
